column4: hi everyone, how to a change the permission settings for /usr/local/bin?
same as for anything else :  chmod
so I just chmod /usr/local/bin?
you probably need to read the man page first and understand what you're doing
what I'm trying to do is install a program in that directory
but I don't have write permission
sudo mv
what does sudo mv do?
gives you permission to move it there
I haven't installed the file yet
so I don't have anything to put after the sudo mv command
what are you trying to install, and more importantly HOW
I'm trying to install the emusic player
for emusic.com
and I've used chmod to open the installer
and it's asking for a file destination, and I heard that it was good to put files in /usr/local/bin
Ubuntu won't let me put a file there though
sudo make install is probably what you want
but you should follow any instructions that came with it...
or learn about how to build and install software (google knows)
do I type the directory name after "sudo make install?"
